macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Futures Mixed Ahead of Open; S&P 500 Down 0.1%, Dow Up 0.1%
items.summary: U.S. futures showed mixed signals with S&P 500 contracts down 0.1% and Dow Jones futures up 0.1%, while European stocks were mixed, Stoxx Europe 600 up 0.1%, FTSE 100 down 0.3%. Asian markets closed mixed with Nikkei down 1.1% and Shanghai Composite up 0.1%.[1]

items.title: S&P 500 Closes Up 0.62% on Tuesday; Wall Street Indices Higher
items.summary: U.S. stocks rose Tuesday with the S&P 500 gaining 42.77 points or 0.62%, supported by broad market strength amid mixed economic signals. NASDAQ closed up 151 points at 23,547 with 60% of stocks rising.[3][4]

items.title: Storage Stocks Surge: SanDisk +27.6%, Western Digital +16.8%, Seagate +14%
items.summary: Storage sector rallied with SanDisk surging 27.56% on high bandwidth memory pricing tailwinds, Western Digital jumping 16.77%, and Seagate gaining 14% amid rotation into data infrastructure plays. Losers included SoFi -7.86% and AIG -7.48% on analyst downgrades.[2]

items.title: Germany Inflation at 1.8% Below ECB Target; US Services PMI Eases to 52.5
items.summary: Germany's inflation slipped to 1.8%, under ECB's 2% target, lowering European bond yields, while US services PMI cooled to 52.5 and logistics index slowed, signaling potential moderation in growth momentum.[1][2]

items.title: Oil Prices Fall: Brent -0.8% to $60.20, WTI -1.2% to $56.47
items.summary: Commodities saw declines with Brent crude down 0.8% to $60.20 per barrel and WTI crude down 1.2% to $56.47, while European natural gas TTF rose 2.7% to 28.83 euros/MWh. Dollar Index edged up 0.1% to 96.03.[1]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Crypto Market Dips on Profit-Taking After Strong 2026 Start
items.summary: The total crypto market capitalization slipped 0.8% to $3.27 trillion, with Bitcoin down 1.4% to $92,660. Altcoins saw steeper losses: Cardano fell 3.2% to $0.4118, Zcash declined 2.8% to $49.50, and Stellar dropped 4.7% to $0.2401, following profit-taking after early January gains.[1]

items.title: Bitcoin Faces Consolidation Amid Stable Leverage and Neutral Momentum
items.summary: Analysts attribute the price pullback to profit-taking after Bitcoin's 7-8% climb from $88,000, with funding rates cooling and Bitcoin dominance below 59% signaling potential altcoin rotation. Fundstrat’s Tom Lee predicts a new all-time high by end of January.[1]

items.title: Bitcoin's 2025 Performance Raises 2026 Recovery Questions
items.summary: Bitcoin fell about 5% in 2025 despite record highs earlier, driven by economic concerns and valuation worries, prompting analysis on its potential bounce back this year.[2]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NVIDIA and Siemens Announce Industrial AI OS Partnership at CES 2026
items.summary: NVIDIA and Siemens unveiled an Industrial AI OS featuring GPU-accelerated simulation tools promising 2× to 10× speed-ups, with a reference AI factory launching in 2026 at Siemens’ Erlangen site; partners include Foxconn and PepsiCo.

items.title: ASUS Launches AI-Powered Copilot+ PCs at CES 2026
items.summary: ASUS revealed new ProArt, Zenbook, Vivobook laptops, desktops, and the world’s first Snapdragon-powered AiO PC, featuring AMD Ryzen AI Max+ 395 processors capable of running 120B-parameter LLMs locally.

items.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang Calls Robots 'AI Immigrants' to Solve Labor Shortages
items.summary: At CES 2026, Huang argued robots will create jobs by addressing manufacturing labor shortages, emphasizing their role as 'AI immigrants' during a media session.

items.title: NVIDIA CEO Announces New Generation Processors in Full Production
items.summary: Jensen Huang revealed at CES that NVIDIA's next-gen processors are in full production, signaling major AI hardware advancements for 2026.

items.title: Researchers Argue Quantum Computing Complements AI, Not Replaces It
items.summary: Quantum computing and AI are complementary, with AI aiding quantum hardware optimization and quantum potentially accelerating AI subroutines like optimization; hype of replacement is dismissed.

items.title: White House Sets FY27 R&D Priorities on AI and Quantum Innovation
items.summary: The U.S. government formalizes AI and quantum as core to national research in health, energy, military, and industry, enabling predictive discovery and smart manufacturing.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass Adds Multiple Surprise Titles on January 7 Including Atomfall and Little Nightmares Remaster
items.summary: Xbox Game Pass launched several surprise games today, such as Atomfall, Lost in Random: The Eternal Die, Rematch, Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine – Master Crafted Edition, and Little Nightmares: Enhanced Edition. Additional titles like Final Fantasy, Star Wars Outlaws, and Resident Evil Village are slated for later in January.

items.title: Microsoft Game Pass January Wave Features Star Wars Outlaws and Resident Evil Village
items.summary: Official Xbox announcement details January Game Pass additions including Atomfall on January 7, Final Fantasy on January 8, Star Wars Outlaws on January 13, and Resident Evil Village on January 20, available across cloud, console, PC, and handheld.

items.title: Rumor: Microsoft Plans Major Layoffs Impacting 11K-22K Employees Including Xbox Division
items.summary: Reports from workers indicate Microsoft is eyeing significant January layoffs affecting Azure cloud, Xbox gaming, and global sales teams due to rising AI costs, though the company has not confirmed.

items.title: Threads Testing Chat-Based Basketball Game to Boost Engagement
items.summary: Meta's Threads app is experimenting with a pixelated basketball mini-game in chats, allowing users to compete by swiping to score baskets, amid efforts to enhance direct messaging features and differentiate from competitors.

items.title: Games Workshop Announces Warhammer Preview Show for January 16
items.summary: Games Workshop scheduled a preview show on January 16 at 7:30PM GMT, promising new announcements for Age of Sigmar, Blood Bowl, Horus Heresy, and Warhammer 40,000.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Intel Unveils Core Ultra Series 3 Processors at CES 2026
items.summary: Intel announced the Core Ultra Series 3 processors, featuring up to 15% better performance per watt and 30% better chip density with Intel 18A process. The company is emphasizing U.S. investments and a new era of local computing capabilities.

items.title: AMD Launches Ryzen AI Processors and Ryzen 7 9850X3D Gaming CPU
items.summary: AMD revealed a new lineup of Ryzen AI processors for on-device acceleration in consumer laptops and the Ryzen 7 9850X3D cache-stacked gaming CPU targeting higher frame rates. CEO Lisa Su highlighted partnerships and data center chips during CES.

items.title: Qualcomm Showcases Snapdragon X2 Series Chips for Laptops
items.summary: Qualcomm is demonstrating the Snapdragon X2 Elite and more affordable Snapdragon X2 Plus chips at CES 2026, promising improved battery life and performance for upcoming laptops from Lenovo, Asus, and Dell.

items.title: Hisense, TCL, and Philips Announce Dolby Vision 2 Support
items.summary: The first TV brands supporting Dolby Vision 2, the next-generation HDR format, are Hisense, TCL, and Philips, with compatible models launching this year as revealed at CES 2026.

items.title: HP Introduces EliteBoard G1a All-in-One Keyboard PC
items.summary: HP unveiled the EliteBoard G1a, a slim 12mm-thick keyboard housing an AMD Ryzen AI 300 series chip, built-in speakers, dual mics, and a user-replaceable battery, showcased at CES 2026.

items.title: Samsung Reveals Galaxy Book 6 Powerhouse Laptop
items.summary: Samsung announced the Galaxy Book 6 laptop with Intel's latest chip architecture, capable of up to 30 hours of video playback, highlighted among powerful computing machines at CES 2026.

items.title: Lenovo Showcases Intuitive Laptops and AI-Powered Monitors at CES
items.summary: Lenovo rolled out new intuitive laptops and monitors with assistance features during CES 2026, setting the stage for upcoming Snapdragon-powered devices.
